page.title: 04KNIPE POINT, CAYTON BAY
page.content: It is an area of wooded cliffs which stretch down to the northern end of Cayton Bay. The area at the top of the cliffs is now occupied by several brick built holiday bungalows with access from Filey road. The area formerly consisted of wooden chalets which formed a NALGO holiday centre.It has also been used as an entertainments centre with bars and live groups, and as a community centre. There are problems with land stability. Footpaths lead down through the woods to the beach, the wooded area being very damp and having lush vegetation. The area has been designated a special site of scientific interest to protect the plant and animal life.
